analyzed: majjhimesu janapadesu paccājātaḥ hoti so ca hoti duppaññaḥ jaḷaḥ eḷamūgaḥ na paṭibalaḥ subhāsita dubbhāsitānam attham aññātu
translated: he is born in a central country, but he is ignorant and incompetent, unable to distinguish right from wrong when it comes to skillful qualities.

original: Ayaṁ aṭṭhamo akkhaṇo asamayo brahmacariyavāsāya.
analyzed: ayam aṭṭhamaḥ akkhaṇaḥ asamayaḥ brahmacariya vāsāya
translated: This is the eighth inopportune, untimely situation for leading the holy life.

original: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, tathāgato ca loke na uppanno hoti arahaṁ sammāsambuddho,
analyzed: puna caparaḥ āvuso tathāgataḥ ca loke na uppannaḥ hoti araham sammāsambuddhaḥ
translated: “And further, the Tathagata does not arise in the world, an Arahant, a Perfectly Enlightened One,

original: dhammo ca na desiyati opasamiko parinibbāniko sambodhagāmī sugatappavedito. Ayañca🔽puggalo majjhimesu janapadesu paccājāto hoti, so ca hoti paññavā ajaḷo aneḷamūgo,
analyzed: dhammo ca na desiyati opasamikaḥ parinibbānikaḥ sambodha gāmī sugata ppavedito ayam ca  puggalaḥ majjhimesu janapadesu paccājātaḥ hoti saḥ ca hoti paññavā a jaḷaḥ an eḷa mūgaḥ
translated: and the Dhamma is not taught that leads to stilling, to total unbinding, to self-awakening as declared by One Well-gone.🔽And this person is born in a central country, and is not deficient in faculties.

original: paṭibalo subhāsitadubbhāsitānamatthamaññātuṁ.
analyzed: paṭibalaḥ su bhāsita dubbhāsitānam attham aññātu
translated: And he is discerning, endowed with discernment leading to the arising of the goal—able to distinguish, as it has come to be, what is truly skillful from what is unskillful.

original: Ayaṁ navamo akkhaṇo asamayo brahmacariyavāsāya.
analyzed: ayam navamaḥ akkhaṇaḥ asamayaḥ brahmacariya vāsāya
translated: This is the ninth inopportune situation.

original: Nava anupubbavihārā.
analyzed: nava anupubbavihārā
translated: “There are these nine step-by-step dwellings.

original: Idhāvuso, bhikkhu vivicceva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaṁ savicāraṁ vivekajaṁ pītisukhaṁ paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati.🔽Vitakkavicārānaṁ vūpasamā …pe… dutiyaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati.🔽Pītiyā ca virāgā …pe… tatiyaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati.
analyzed: idha āvuso bhikkhu vivicca iva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi sa vitakkam sa vicāram viveka jam pīti sukham paṭhamam jhānam upasampajja viharati  vitakka vicārānam vūpasamā pe dutiyam jhānam upasampajja viharati  pītiyā ca virāgā pe tatiyam jhānam upasampajja viharati
translated: “There is the case where a monk, quite secluded from sensuality, secluded from unskillful qualities, enters & remains in the first jhāna: rapture & pleasure born of seclusion, accompanied by directed thought & evaluation.🔽With the stilling of directed thoughts & evaluations, he enters & remains in the second jhāna: rapture & pleasure born of concentration, unification of awareness free from directed thought & evaluation—internal assurance.🔽With the fading of rapture, he remains equanimous, mindful, & alert, and senses pleasure with the body. He enters & remains in the third jhāna, of which the noble ones declare, ‘Equanimous & mindful, he has a pleasant abiding.’

original: Sukhassa ca pahānā …pe… catutthaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati.
analyzed: sukhassa ca pahānā pe catuttham jhānam upasampajja viharati
translated: With the abandoning of pleasure & pain—as with the earlier disappearance of elation & distress—he enters & remains in the fourth jhāna: purity of equanimity & mindfulness, neither pleasure nor pain.

original: Sabbaso rūpasaññānaṁ samatikkamā …pe… ākāsānañcāyatanaṁ upasampajja viharati.
analyzed: sabbaso rūpa saññānam samatikkamā pe ākāsa ānañca āyatanam upasampajja viharati
translated: With the complete surmounting of perceptions of form, with the disappearance of perceptions of sensory impact, with non-attention to perceptions of diversity, aware that ‘space is infinite,’ he enters and dwells in the base of the infinity of space.

original: Sabbaso ākāsānañcāyatanaṁ samatikkamma ‘anantaṁ viññāṇan’ti viññāṇañcāyatanaṁ upasampajja viharati.
analyzed: sabbaso ākāsānañcāyatanam samatikkamma anantam viññāṇanti viññāṇañcāyatanam upasampajja viharati
translated: With the complete surmounting of the base of the infinity of space, aware that ‘consciousness is infinite,’ he enters and dwells in the base of the infinity of consciousness.

original: Sabbaso viññāṇañcāyatanaṁ samatikkamma ‘natthi kiñcī’ti ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ upasampajja viharati.🔽Sabbaso ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ samatikkamma nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṁ upasampajja viharati.
analyzed: sabbasas viññāṇañca āyatanam samatikkamma na atthi kiñci iti ākiñcaññāyatanam upasampajja viharati  sabbaso ākiñcaññāyatanam samatikkamma nevasaññānāsaññāyatanam upasampajja viharati
translated: With the complete surmounting of the base of the infinity of consciousness, aware that ‘there is nothing,’ he enters and dwells in the base of nothingness.🔽With the complete surmounting of the base of nothingness, he enters and dwells in the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.

original: Sabbaso nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṁ samatikkamma saññāvedayitanirodhaṁ upasampajja viharati.
analyzed: sabbasas nevasaññā nāsañña āyatanam samatikkamma saññā vedayita nirodham upasampajja viharati
translated: With the complete surmounting of the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, he enters and dwells in the cessation of perception and feeling.

original: Nava anupubbanirodhā.
analyzed: nava anupubba nirodhā
translated: Nine successive cessations.

original: Paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ samāpannassa kāmasaññā niruddhā hoti.🔽Dutiyaṁ jhānaṁ samāpannassa vitakkavicārā niruddhā honti.🔽Tatiyaṁ jhānaṁ samāpannassa pīti niruddhā hoti.
analyzed: paṭhamam jhānam samāpannassa kāma saññā niruddhā hoti  dutiyam jhānam samāpannassa vitakka vicārāḥ niruddhāḥ honti  tatiyam jhānam samāpannassa pīti niruddhā hoti
translated: When one has attained the first jhana, perceptions of sensuality have ceased.🔽When one has attained the second jhana, directed thoughts and evaluations have ceased.🔽When one has attained the third jhana, rapture has ceased.

original: Catutthaṁ jhānaṁ samāpannassa assāsapassāssā niruddhā honti.
analyzed: catuttham jhānam samāpannassa assāsa passāssāḥ niruddhāḥ honti
translated: When one has attained the fourth jhana, in-and-out breaths have ceased.

original: Ākāsānañcāyatanaṁ samāpannassa rūpasaññā niruddhā hoti.🔽Viññāṇañcāyatanaṁ samāpannassa ākāsānañcāyatanasaññā niruddhā hoti.🔽Ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ samāpannassa viññāṇañcāyatanasaññā niruddhā hoti.
analyzed: ākāsānañcāyatanam samāpannassa rūpa saññā niruddhā hoti  viññāṇañcāyatanam samāpannassa ākāsānañcāyatana saññā niruddhā hoti  ākiñcaññāyatanam samāpannassa viññāṇañcāyatana saññā niruddhā hoti
translated: When someone has attained the dimension of the infinitude of space, perceptions of form have ceased.🔽When someone has attained the dimension of the infinitude of consciousness, perceptions of the dimension of the infinitude of space have ceased.🔽When someone has attained the dimension of nothingness, perceptions of the dimension of the infinitude of consciousness have ceased.

original: Nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṁ samāpannassa ākiñcaññāyatanasaññā niruddhā hoti.
analyzed: nevasaññānāsaññāyatanam samāpannassa ākiñcaññāyatana saññā niruddhā hoti
translated: When someone has attained the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception, perceptions of the dimension of nothingness have ceased.

original: Saññāvedayitanirodhaṁ samāpannassa saññā ca vedanā ca niruddhā honti.
analyzed: saññā vedayita nirodham samāpannassa saññā ca vedanā ca niruddhā honti
translated: When someone has attained the cessation of perception and feeling, perception and feeling have ceased.

original: Ime kho, āvuso, tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena nava dhammā sammadakkhātā.
analyzed: ime kho āvuso tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena nava dhammā sammad akkhātā
translated: “These, friends, are the nine dhammas that are rightly expounded by the Blessed One—the one who knows, the one who sees, the Worthy One, rightly self-awakened.🔽“In this regard, all of you should rehearse them together, blend them together, and not divide them.

original: Tattha sabbeheva saṅgāyitabbaṁ …pe… atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṁ.
analyzed: tattha sabbehi iva saṅgāyitabbam pe atthāya hitāya sukhāya deva manussāna
translated: “This will be for your long-term welfare & happiness.

original: 10. Dasaka
analyzed: dasaka
translated: . Ten

original: Atthi kho, āvuso, tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena dasa dhammā sammadakkhātā.
analyzed: atthi kho āvuso tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena dasa dhammā sammad akkhātā
translated: “There are, friends, ten dhammas that are rightly expounded by the Blessed One—the one who knows, the one who sees, the Worthy One, rightly self-awakened.🔽“In this regard, all of you should rehearse them together, blend them together, and not divide them.

original: Tattha sabbeheva saṅgāyitabbaṁ …pe… atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṁ.
analyzed: tattha sabbehi iva saṅgāyitabbam pe atthāya hitāya sukhāya deva manussāna
translated: “This will be for your long-term welfare & happiness.

original: Katame dasa?
analyzed: katame dasa
translated: What are the ten?

original: Dasa nāthakaraṇā dhammā.🔽Idhāvuso, bhikkhu sīlavā hoti. Pātimokkhasaṁvarasaṁvuto viharati ācāragocarasampanno, aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu.
analyzed: dasa nātha karaṇāḥ dhammā  idha āvuso bhikkhu sīlavā hoti pātimokkha savara savutaḥ viharati ācāra gocara sampannaḥ aṇumattesu vajjesu bhaya dassāvī samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu
translated: Ten qualities that are a protection.🔽Here, a bhikkhu is virtuous, he dwells restrained with the restraint of the Patimokkha, he is perfect in conduct and resort, and seeing fear in the slightest fault, he trains by undertaking the training precepts.

original: Yaṁpāvuso, bhikkhu sīlavā hoti, pātimokkhasaṁvarasaṁvuto viharati, ācāragocarasampanno, aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu.🔽Ayampi dhammo nāthakaraṇo.🔽Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu bahussuto hoti sutadharo sutasannicayo. Ye te dhammā
analyzed: yapāvuso bhikkhu sīlavā hoti pātimokkha savara savutaḥ viharati ācāra gocara sampannaḥ aṇumattesu vajjesu bhaya dassāvī samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu  ayam pi dhammo nātha karaṇo  puna caparaḥ āvuso bhikkhu bahu ssutaḥ hoti suta dharaḥ suta sannicayaḥ ye te dhammā
translated: “When a bhikkhu is virtuous…and he trains by undertaking the training precepts, this is a quality that is a protection.

original: ādikalyāṇā majjhekalyāṇā pariyosānakalyāṇā sātthā sabyañjanā kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ🔽brahmacariyaṁ abhivadanti, tathārūpāssa dhammā bahussutā honti dhātā vacasā paricitā
analyzed: ādi kalyāṇā majjhe kalyāṇā pariyosāna kalyāṇā sa atthā sa byañjanā kevala paripuṇṇam parisuddha  brahmacariyam abhivadanti tathārūpāssa dhammāḥ bahu sutāḥ honti dhātā vacasā paricitā
translated: “Again, a bhikkhu is learned, he retains what he has learned, and the teachings he has learned are wholesome in the beginning, wholesome in the middle, and wholesome in the end, with the right meaning and phrasing, and they proclaim the perfectly complete and pure spiritual life.

original: manasānupekkhitā diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā.
analyzed: manasā an upekkhitā diṭṭhiyā su paṭividdhā
translated: Such teachings he has learned much of, retained in mind, recited verbally, investigated mentally, and penetrated well by view.

original: Yaṁpāvuso, bhikkhu bahussuto hoti …pe… diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā.
analyzed: yapāvuso bhikkhu bahu ssutaḥ hoti pe diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā
translated: “And further, the monk is learned, remembers and keeps what he has learned, and shares what he has learned.

original: Ayampi dhammo nāthakaraṇo.
analyzed: ayam pi dhammo nātha karaṇo
translated: This is the quality that makes one a refuge.

original: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu kalyāṇamitto hoti kalyāṇasahāyo kalyāṇasampavaṅko.🔽Yaṁpāvuso, bhikkhu kalyāṇamitto hoti kalyāṇasahāyo kalyāṇasampavaṅko.
analyzed: puna caparaḥ āvuso bhikkhu kalyāṇa mittaḥ hoti kalyāṇa sahāyaḥ kalyāṇa sampavaṅkaḥ  yapāvuso bhikkhu kalyāṇa mittaḥ hoti kalyāṇa sahāyaḥ kalyāṇa sampavaṅkaḥ
translated: “And further, the monk has good friends, good companions, good comrades.

original: Ayampi dhammo nāthakaraṇo.🔽Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu suvaco hoti sovacassakaraṇehi dhammehi samannāgato khamo padakkhiṇaggāhī anusāsaniṁ.
analyzed: ayam pi dhammo nātha karaṇo  puna caparaḥ āvuso bhikkhu suvacaḥ hoti sovacassakaraṇehi dhammehi samannāgataḥ khamaḥ padakkhiṇa ggāhī anusāsani
translated: This is the quality that makes one a refuge.

original: Yaṁpāvuso, bhikkhu suvaco hoti …pe… padakkhiṇaggāhī anusāsaniṁ.
analyzed: yapa āvuso bhikkhu su vacaḥ hoti pe padakkhiṇa ggāhī anusāsani
translated: “And further, the monk is easy to speak to, possesses qualities that make him easy to speak to, and is endowed with humility, pliable, and respectful.

original: Ayampi dhammo nāthakaraṇo.
analyzed: ayam pi dhammo nātha karaṇo
translated: This is the quality that makes one a refuge.

original: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu yāni tāni sabrahmacārīnaṁ uccāvacāni kiṅkaraṇīyāni, tattha dakkho hoti analaso tatrupāyāya vīmaṁsāya samannāgato, alaṁ kātuṁ alaṁ saṁvidhātuṁ.
analyzed: puna caparaḥ āvuso bhikkhu yāni tāni sabrahmacārīnam uccāvacāni kiṅkaraṇīyāni tattha dakkhaḥ hoti analasaḥ vīmasāya samannāgataḥ alam kātum alam savidhātu
translated: “And further, the monk is skilled and diligent in attending to the diverse chores that are to be done for his fellow monks, and he is competent in attending to their various duties.

original: Yaṁpāvuso, bhikkhu yāni tāni sabrahmacārīnaṁ …pe… alaṁ saṁvidhātuṁ.
analyzed: yapa āvuso bhikkhu yāni tāni sabrahmacārīnam pe alam
translated: “And further, the monk is one who shares equally what is given in faith, whether it is good or bad.

original: Ayampi dhammo nāthakaraṇo.🔽Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu dhammakāmo hoti piyasamudāhāro, abhidhamme abhivinaye uḷārapāmojjo.
analyzed: ayam pi dhammo nātha karaṇo  puna caparaḥ āvuso bhikkhu dhamma kāmaḥ hoti piya samudāhāraḥ abhidhamme abhivinaye uḷāra pāmojjaḥ
translated: This is the quality that makes him a refuge.

original: Yaṁpāvuso, bhikkhu dhammakāmo hoti …pe… uḷārapāmojjo.
analyzed: yapa āvuso bhikkhu dhamma kāmo hoti pe uḷāra pāmojjo
translated: “And further, the monk is one who delights in the Dhamma, conversation on the Dhamma, and is a receptacle for the Dhamma, being endowed with the Dhamma, delighting in the Dhamma, devoted to the Dhamma, and a relisher of the taste of the Dhamma.

original: Ayampi dhammo nāthakaraṇo.
analyzed: ayam pi dhammo nātha karaṇo
translated: This is the quality that makes him a refuge.

original: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu santuṭṭho hoti itarītarehi cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārehi.🔽Yaṁpāvuso, bhikkhu santuṭṭho hoti …pe… parikkhārehi.
analyzed: puna caparaḥ āvuso bhikkhu santuṭṭhaḥ hoti itarītarehi cīvara piṇḍapāta senāsana gilāna ppaccaya bhesajja parikkhārehi  yapāvuso bhikkhu santuṭṭhaḥ hoti pe parikkhārehi
translated: “And further, the monk is content with any kind of almsfood and with any kind of resting place.

original: Ayampi dhammo nāthakaraṇo.
analyzed: ayam pi dhammo nātha karaṇo
translated: This is the quality that makes him a refuge.

original: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu āraddhavīriyo viharati akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ pahānāya kusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ upasampadāya, thāmavā daḷhaparakkamo anikkhittadhuro kusalesu dhammesu.
analyzed: puna caparaḥ āvuso bhikkhu āraddha vīriyaḥ viharati akusalānam dhammānam pahānāya kusalānam dhammānam upasampadāya thāmavā daḷha parakkamaḥ a nikkhitta dhuraḥ kusalesu dhammesu
translated: “And further, the monk is one of aroused energy, who lives with energy aroused for the abandoning of unwholesome states and the acquisition of wholesome states. He is strong, firm in exertion, not shirking the responsibility of cultivating wholesome states.

original: Yaṁpāvuso, bhikkhu āraddhavīriyo viharati …pe… anikkhittadhuro kusalesu dhammesu.
analyzed: yapāvuso bhikkhu āraddha vīriyaḥ viharati pe a nikkhitta dhuraḥ kusalesu dhammesu
translated: When a bhikkhu lives with energy aroused…

original: Ayampi dhammo nāthakaraṇo.🔽Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu satimā hoti paramena satinepakkena samannāgato cirakatampi cirabhāsitampi saritā anussaritā.
analyzed: ayam pi dhammo nātha karaṇo  puna caparaḥ āvuso bhikkhu satimā hoti paramena sati nepakkena samannāgataḥ cirakatam pi cira bhāsitam pi saritā anussaritā
translated: This is the quality that makes one independent.🔽“Again, a bhikkhu is greatly mindful, possessing supreme mindfulness and alertness, one who remembers and recollects what was done and said a long time ago.

original: Yaṁpāvuso, bhikkhu satimā hoti …pe… saritā anussaritā.
analyzed: yapāvuso bhikkhu satimā hoti pe saritā anussaritā
translated: When a bhikkhu is greatly mindful…

original: Ayampi dhammo nāthakaraṇo.🔽Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu paññavā hoti, udayatthagāminiyā paññāya samannāgato ariyāya nibbedhikāya sammādukkhakkhayagāminiyā.
analyzed: ayam pi dhammo nātha karaṇo  puna caparaḥ āvuso bhikkhu paññavā hoti udaya ttha gāminiyā paññāya samannāgataḥ ariyāya nibbedhikāya sammādukkha kkhaya gāminiyā
translated: This is the quality that makes one independent.🔽“Again, a bhikkhu is wise; he possesses the wisdom that discerns arising and passing away, which is noble and penetrative and leads to the complete destruction of suffering.

original: Yaṁpāvuso, bhikkhu paññavā hoti …pe… sammādukkhakkhayagāminiyā.
analyzed: yapa āvuso bhikkhu paññavā hoti pe sammādukkha khaya gāminiyā
translated: When a bhikkhu is wise…

original: Ayampi dhammo nāthakaraṇo.
analyzed: ayam pi dhammo nātha karaṇo
translated: This is the quality that makes one independent.

original: Dasa kasiṇāyatanāni.🔽Pathavīkasiṇameko sañjānāti, uddhaṁ adho tiriyaṁ advayaṁ appamāṇaṁ.🔽Āpokasiṇameko sañjānāti …pe…
analyzed: dasa kasiṇāyatanāni  pathavī kasiṇam ekaḥ sañjānāti uddham adhas tiriyam advayam appamāṇa  sañjānāti pe
translated: “There are ten kasiṇa bases.🔽One perceives the earth kasiṇa above, below, across, without measure, without end.🔽One perceives the water kasiṇa…

original: tejokasiṇameko sañjānāti …
analyzed: tejaḥ kasiṇam ekaḥ sañjānāti
translated: One perceives the fire kasiṇa…

original: vāyokasiṇameko sañjānāti …
analyzed: vāyu kasiṇam ekaḥ sañjānāti
translated: One perceives the air kasiṇa …

original: nīlakasiṇameko sañjānāti …🔽pītakasiṇameko sañjānāti …🔽lohitakasiṇameko sañjānāti …
analyzed: nīla kasiṇam ekaḥ sañjānāti  pīta kasiṇam ekaḥ sañjānāti  lohita kasiṇam ekaḥ sañjānāti
translated: One perceives the blue kasiṇa …🔽One perceives the yellow kasiṇa …🔽One perceives the red kasiṇa …

original: odātakasiṇameko sañjānāti …
analyzed: odāta kasiṇam ekaḥ sañjānāti
translated: One perceives the white kasiṇa …

original: ākāsakasiṇameko sañjānāti …
analyzed: ākāsa kasiṇam ekaḥ sañjānāti
translated: One perceives the space kasiṇa …

original: viññāṇakasiṇameko sañjānāti, uddhaṁ adho tiriyaṁ advayaṁ appamāṇaṁ.
analyzed: viññāṇa kasiṇam ekaḥ sañjānāti uddham adhas tiriyam advayam appamāṇa
translated: One perceives the consciousness kasiṇa above, below, across, without making any distinction between them.

original: Dasa akusalakammapathā—
analyzed: dasa akusala kamma pathā
translated: There are ten courses of unskillful action:🔽taking life, taking what is not given, sexual misconduct, telling lies,

original: pāṇātipāto, adinnādānaṁ, kāmesumicchācāro, musāvādo, pisuṇā vācā, pharusā vācā, samphappalāpo, abhijjhā, byāpādo, micchādiṭṭhi.
analyzed: pāṇa atipātaḥ adinnādāna kāmesu micchācāraḥ musāvādaḥ pisuṇā vācā pharusā vācā samphappalāpaḥ abhijjhā byāpādaḥ micchādiṭṭhi
translated: slander, harsh speech, idle chatter, greed, ill will, wrong view.

original: Dasa kusalakammapathā—
analyzed: dasa kusala kamma pathā
translated: There are ten courses of skillful action:

original: pāṇātipātā veramaṇī, adinnādānā veramaṇī, kāmesumicchācārā veramaṇī, musāvādā veramaṇī,🔽pisuṇāya vācāya veramaṇī, pharusāya vācāya veramaṇī, samphappalāpā veramaṇī, anabhijjhā,
analyzed: pāṇa atipātā veramaṇī adinna ādānā veramaṇī kāmesumicchā ācārā veramaṇī musāvādā veramaṇī  pisuṇāya vācāya veramaṇī pharusāya vācāya veramaṇī samphappalāpā veramaṇī anabhijjhā
translated: refraining from taking life, refraining from taking what is not given, refraining from sexual misconduct, refraining from telling lies,

original: abyāpādo, sammādiṭṭhi.
analyzed: a byāpādaḥ sammādiṭṭhi
translated: refraining from slander, refraining from harsh speech, refraining from idle chatter, non-greed, non-ill will, right view.

original: Dasa ariyavāsā.
analyzed: dasa ariya vāsā
translated: There are ten ways of living in a lofty place.

original: Idhāvuso, bhikkhu pañcaṅgavippahīno hoti, chaḷaṅgasamannāgato, ekārakkho, caturāpasseno,
analyzed: idha āvuso bhikkhu pañcaṅga vippahīnaḥ hoti chaḍaṅga samannāgataḥ eka ārakkhaḥ catur āpassenaḥ
translated: Here, friend, a bhikkhu has abandoned the five lower fetters. He possesses the six factors. He has one guard. He has four supports. He has three firm grounds. He has three knowledges. He has six things that inspire confidence. He has seven good qualities. He has eight good qualities of conduct. He has nine factors of the aggregates of noble virtue. He has ten good qualities.

original: paṇunnapaccekasacco, samavayasaṭṭhesano, anāvilasaṅkappo, passaddhakāyasaṅkhāro,
analyzed: paṇunna paccekasaccaḥ sama vaya saṭṭhesanaḥ anāvila saṅkappo passaddha kāya saṅkhāro
translated: There is the case where a monk has abandoned five factors, is endowed with six, guards one, is supported in four, has shaken off idiosyncratic truths, has thoroughly given up searching, has stilled his cognizance, has tranquilized his bodily processes,

original: suvimuttacitto, suvimuttapañño.
analyzed: su vimutta cittaḥ su vimutta paññaḥ
translated: is well released in mind, and well released in discernment.

original: Kathañcāvuso, bhikkhu pañcaṅgavippahīno hoti?
analyzed: kathañca āvuso bhikkhu pañcaṅga vippahīnaḥ hoti
translated: “And how, friends, has a monk abandoned five factors?

original: Idhāvuso, bhikkhuno kāmacchando pahīno hoti, byāpādo pahīno hoti, thinamiddhaṁ pahīnaṁ hoti, uddhaccakukkuccaṁ pahīnaṁ hoti, vicikicchā pahīnā hoti.
analyzed: idha āvuso bhikkhuno kāmacchandaḥ pahīnaḥ hoti byāpādaḥ pahīnaḥ hoti thinamiddham pahīnam hoti uddhacca kukkuccam pahīnam hoti vicikicchā pahīnā hoti
translated: There is the case where a monk has abandoned passion, abandoned aversion, abandoned delusion, abandoned conceit, abandoned a skeptical-perplexed view.

original: Evaṁ kho, āvuso, bhikkhu pañcaṅgavippahīno hoti.
analyzed: evam kho āvuso bhikkhu pañcaṅga vippahīnaḥ hoti
translated: This is how a monk has abandoned five factors.

original: Kathañcāvuso, bhikkhu chaḷaṅgasamannāgato hoti?
analyzed: kathañca āvuso bhikkhu chaḷaṅga samannāgataḥ hoti
translated: “And how, friends, is a monk endowed with six factors?

original: Idhāvuso, bhikkhu cakkhunā rūpaṁ disvā neva sumano hoti na dummano, upekkhako viharati sato sampajāno.
analyzed: idha āvuso bhikkhu cakkhunā rūpam disvā na iva sumanaḥ hoti na dummanaḥ upekkhakaḥ viharati sataḥ sampajānaḥ
translated: There is the case where a monk, on seeing a form via the eye, is neither gladdened nor saddened, but remains equanimous, mindful, & alert.

original: Sotena saddaṁ sutvā …pe…
analyzed: sotena saddam sutvā pe
translated: On hearing a sound via the ear…🔽On smelling an aroma via the nose…

original: manasā dhammaṁ viññāya neva sumano hoti na dummano, upekkhako viharati sato sampajāno.
analyzed: manasā dhammam viññāya na iva su manaḥ hoti na dummanaḥ upekkhakaḥ viharati sataḥ sampajāno
translated: Having known a mind with the mind, he is neither gladdened nor saddened, but remains equanimous, mindful and clearly aware.

original: Evaṁ kho, āvuso, bhikkhu chaḷaṅgasamannāgato hoti.
analyzed: evam kho āvuso bhikkhu chaḷaṅga samannāgataḥ hoti
translated: It is in such a way that a bhikkhu possesses six factors.

original: Kathañcāvuso, bhikkhu ekārakkho hoti?
analyzed: kathañca āvuso bhikkhu eka ārakkhaḥ hoti
translated: “And how, friends, does a bhikkhu have one guard?

original: Idhāvuso, bhikkhu satārakkhena cetasā samannāgato hoti.
analyzed: idha āvuso bhikkhu sa tārakkhena cetasā samannāgataḥ hoti
translated: Here, a bhikkhu possesses the guard of the doors of the sense faculties.

original: Evaṁ kho, āvuso, bhikkhu ekārakkho hoti.
analyzed: evam kho āvuso bhikkhu eka ārakkhaḥ hoti
translated: It is in such a way that a bhikkhu has one guard.

original: Kathañcāvuso, bhikkhu caturāpasseno hoti?
analyzed: katham ca āvuso bhikkhu catu rāpassenaḥ hoti
translated: “And how, friends, does a bhikkhu have four grounds for making a declaration?

original: Idhāvuso, bhikkhu saṅkhāyekaṁ paṭisevati, saṅkhāyekaṁ adhivāseti, saṅkhāyekaṁ parivajjeti, saṅkhāyekaṁ vinodeti.
analyzed: idha āvuso bhikkhu saṅkhāya ekam paṭisevati saṅkhāya ekam adhivāseti saṅkhāya ekam parivajjeti saṅkhāya ekam vinodeti
translated: Here, a bhikkhu makes use of things after proper reflection; he endures them after proper reflection; he avoids them after proper reflection; he removes them after proper reflection.

original: Evaṁ kho, āvuso, bhikkhu caturāpasseno hoti.
analyzed: evam kho āvuso bhikkhu catur āpassenaḥ hoti
translated: It is in such a way that a bhikkhu has four grounds for making a declaration.

original: Kathañcāvuso, bhikkhu paṇunnapaccekasacco hoti?
analyzed: kathañca āvuso bhikkhu paṇunna paccekasaccaḥ hoti
translated: “And how, friends, does a bhikkhu have a keen regard for moral shame?

original: Idhāvuso, bhikkhuno yāni tāni puthusamaṇabrāhmaṇānaṁ puthupaccekasaccāni, sabbāni tāni nunnāni honti paṇunnāni cattāni vantāni muttāni pahīnāni paṭinissaṭṭhāni.
analyzed: idha āvuso bhikkhunaḥ yāni tāni puthu samaṇa brāhmaṇānam puthu paccekasaccāni sabbāni tāni nunnāni honti paṇunnāni cattāni vantāni muttāni pahīnāni paṭinissaṭṭhāni
translated: Here, a bhikkhu has thrown off those taints that defile, bring renewal of being, give trouble, ripen in suffering, and lead to future birth, ageing, and death.

original: Evaṁ kho, āvuso, bhikkhu paṇunnapaccekasacco hoti.
analyzed: evam kho āvuso bhikkhu paṇunna paccekasaccaḥ hoti
translated: That is how a bhikkhu is one who has rejected the lower section of the twofold doctrine.

original: Kathañcāvuso, bhikkhu samavayasaṭṭhesano hoti?
analyzed: kathañca āvuso bhikkhu samavaya saṭṭhesanaḥ hoti
translated: “And how is a bhikkhu one who has shared the outcasts’ bed?

original: Idhāvuso, bhikkhuno kāmesanā pahīnā hoti, bhavesanā pahīnā hoti, brahmacariyesanā paṭippassaddhā.
analyzed: idha āvuso bhikkhuno kāma īsanā pahīnā hoti bhava īsanā pahīnā hoti brahmacariya īsanā paṭippassaddhā
translated: Here, a bhikkhu has abandoned the search for sensual pleasures and the search for existence and has allayed the search for a spiritual life.

original: Evaṁ kho, āvuso, bhikkhu samavayasaṭṭhesano hoti.
analyzed: evam kho āvuso bhikkhu samavaya saṭṭhesanaḥ hoti
translated: That is how a bhikkhu is one who has shared the outcasts’ bed.

original: Kathañcāvuso, bhikkhu anāvilasaṅkappo hoti?
analyzed: kathañca āvuso bhikkhu anāvila saṅkappaḥ hoti
translated: “And how is a bhikkhu one whose thoughts are untainted?

original: Idhāvuso, bhikkhuno kāmasaṅkappo pahīno hoti, byāpādasaṅkappo pahīno hoti, vihiṁsāsaṅkappo pahīno hoti.
analyzed: idha āvuso bhikkhuno kāma saṅkappaḥ pahīnaḥ hoti byāpāda saṅkappaḥ pahīnaḥ hoti vihisā saṅkappaḥ pahīnaḥ hoti
translated: Here, a bhikkhu has abandoned thoughts of sensual desire, thoughts of ill will, and thoughts of cruelty.

original: Evaṁ kho, āvuso, bhikkhu anāvilasaṅkappo hoti.
analyzed: evam kho āvuso bhikkhu anāvila saṅkappaḥ hoti
translated: That is how a bhikkhu is one whose thoughts are untainted.

original: Kathañcāvuso, bhikkhu passaddhakāyasaṅkhāro hoti?
analyzed: kathañca āvuso bhikkhu passaddha kāya saṅkhāraḥ hoti
translated: “And how is a bhikkhu one who has stilled bodily activity?

original: Idhāvuso, bhikkhu sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā pubbeva somanassadomanassānaṁ atthaṅgamā adukkhamasukhaṁ upekkhāsatipārisuddhiṁ catutthaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati.
analyzed: idha āvuso bhikkhu sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā pubbe eva somanassa domanassānam atthaṅgamā adukkham asukham upekkhā sati pārisuddhim catuttham jhānam upasampajja viharati
translated: Here, a bhikkhu, with the abandoning of pleasure and pain, and with the previous passing away of joy and displeasure, enters and dwells in the fourth jhana, neither painful nor pleasant, which has purification of mindfulness by equanimity.

original: Evaṁ kho, āvuso, bhikkhu passaddhakāyasaṅkhāro hoti.
analyzed: evam kho āvuso bhikkhu passaddha kāya saṅkhāraḥ hoti
translated: That’s how a monk has calmed bodily activity.

original: Kathañcāvuso, bhikkhu suvimuttacitto hoti?
analyzed: kathañca āvuso bhikkhu su vimutta cittaḥ hoti
translated: “And how is a monk well released in mind?

original: Idhāvuso, bhikkhuno rāgā cittaṁ vimuttaṁ hoti, dosā cittaṁ vimuttaṁ hoti, mohā cittaṁ vimuttaṁ hoti.
analyzed: idha āvuso bhikkhuno rāgā cittam vimuttam hoti dosā cittam vimuttam hoti mohā cittam vimuttam hoti
translated: It’s when a monk’s mind is released from passion, released from aversion, released from delusion.

original: Evaṁ kho, āvuso, bhikkhu suvimuttacitto hoti.
analyzed: evam kho āvuso bhikkhu su vimutta cittaḥ hoti
translated: That’s how a monk is well released in mind.

original: Kathañcāvuso, bhikkhu suvimuttapañño hoti?
analyzed: kathañca āvuso bhikkhu su vimutta paññaḥ hoti
translated: “And how is a monk well released in discernment?

original: Idhāvuso, bhikkhu ‘rāgo me pahīno ucchinnamūlo tālāvatthukato anabhāvaṅkato āyatiṁ anuppādadhammo’ti pajānāti.🔽‘Doso me pahīno ucchinnamūlo tālāvatthukato anabhāvaṅkato āyatiṁ anuppādadhammo’ti pajānāti.
analyzed: idha āvuso bhikkhu rāgaḥ me pahīnaḥ ucchinna mūlaḥ tālāvatthukataḥ anabhāvaṅkataḥ āyatim an uppāda dhammo ti pajānāti  dosaḥ me pahīnaḥ ucchinna mūlo tālā vatthukataḥ anabhāvaṅkataḥ āyatim an uppāda dhammo ti pajānāti
translated: It’s when a monk discerns, ‘Passion is given up in me, its root destroyed, made like a palmyra stump, deprived of the conditions of development, not destined for future arising.’🔽He discerns, ‘Aversion is given up in me, its root destroyed, made like a palmyra stump, deprived of the conditions of development, not destined for future arising.’

original: ‘Moho me pahīno ucchinnamūlo tālāvatthukato anabhāvaṅkato āyatiṁ anuppādadhammo’ti pajānāti.
analyzed: mohaḥ me pahīnaḥ ucchinna mūlo tālā vatthukataḥ anabhāvaṅkataḥ āyatim an uppāda dhammo ti pajānāti
translated: He discerns, ‘Delusion is given up in me, its root destroyed, made like a palmyra stump, deprived of the conditions of development, not destined for future arising.’

original: Evaṁ kho, āvuso, bhikkhu suvimuttapañño hoti.
analyzed: evam kho āvuso bhikkhu su vimutta paññaḥ hoti
translated: That’s how a monk is well released in discernment.

original: Dasa asekkhā dhammā—
analyzed: dasa asekkhā dhammā
translated: Ten qualities of one beyond training:

original: asekkhā sammādiṭṭhi, asekkho sammāsaṅkappo, asekkhā sammāvācā, asekkho sammākammanto,
analyzed: asekkhā sammā diṭṭhi asekkhaḥ sammā saṅkappo asekkhā sammā vācā asekkhaḥ sammā kammanto
translated: Right view, right thought, right speech, right action,

original: asekkho sammāājīvo, asekkho sammāvāyāmo, asekkhā sammāsati, asekkho sammāsamādhi,
analyzed: asekkhaḥ sammāājīvaḥ asekkhaḥ sammāvāyāmaḥ asekkhā sammā sati asekkhaḥ sammā samādhi
translated: right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right concentration,

original: asekkhaṁ sammāñāṇaṁ, asekkhā sammāvimutti.
analyzed: asekkham sammāñāṇa asekkhā sammāvimutti
translated: right knowledge, and right freedom.

original: Ime kho, āvuso, tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena dasa dhammā sammadakkhātā.🔽Tattha sabbeheva saṅgāyitabbaṁ na vivaditabbaṁ, yathayidaṁ brahmacariyaṁ addhaniyaṁ🔽assa ciraṭṭhitikaṁ, tadassa bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya
analyzed: ime kho āvuso tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena dasa dhammā sammad akkhātā  tattha sabbehi iva na vivaditabba yathā idam brahmacariyam  assa ciraṭṭhitika tat assa bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya loka anukampāya atthāya
translated: “These are the ten things that are rightly expounded by the Blessed One, the one who knows and sees, the Worthy One, the Perfect Buddha.

original: hitāya sukhāya devamanussānan”ti.
analyzed: hitāya sukhāya deva manussānanti
translated: They should all be recited together, without dispute, so that this holy life will endure & last a long time, and that will be for the benefit & happiness of many, out of sympathy for the world, for the welfare, benefit, & happiness of devas & human beings.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā uṭṭhahitvā āyasmantaṁ sāriputtaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā uṭṭhahitvā āyasmantam sāriputtam āmantesi
translated: Then the Blessed One got up from his seat and addressed Ven. Sāriputta,

original: “sādhu sādhu, sāriputta,
analyzed: sādhu sādhu sāriputta
translated: “Good, good, Sāriputta!

original: sādhu kho tvaṁ, sāriputta, bhikkhūnaṁ saṅgītipariyāyaṁ abhāsī”ti.
analyzed: sādhu kho tva sāriputta bhikkhūnam saṅgīti pariyāyam abhāsi iti
translated: It’s good that you have recited the Dhamma concordance for the monks.”

original: Idamavocāyasmā sāriputto, samanuñño satthā ahosi.
analyzed: idam avoca ayasmā sāriputto samanuññaḥ satthā ahosi
translated: That is what the venerable Sāriputta said. The Teacher approved.

original: Attamanā te bhikkhū āyasmato sāriputtassa bhāsitaṁ abhinandunti.
analyzed: attamanāḥ te bhikkhū āyasmataḥ sāriputtassa bhāsitam abhinandunti
translated: And the bhikkhus were satisfied and delighted in the venerable Sāriputta’s words.

original: Saṅgītisuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ dasamaṁ.
analyzed: saṅgīti suttam niṭṭhitam dasama
translated: The tenth sutta in the Saṅgīti vagga,
